com.github.maxstupo.flatengine.util

Class ObjectSpatialPartitioner<T extends AbstractSpatialObject<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.maxstupo.flatengine.util.ObjectSpatialPartitioner<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the object type.

    public class ObjectSpatialPartitioner<T extends AbstractSpatialObject<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows for objects to be partitioned into a grid (chunks) which can increase performance. Rather than iterating over all objects, the partitioner will allow iterating over select chunks. Using methods such as getObjectsInRectangle(int, int, int, int), getObjectsInArea(int, int, int), etc..
    Author:
    Maxstupo

        Create a new ObjectSpatialPartitioner object.
        Parameters:
        gridWidth - the number of units in width.
        gridHeight - the number of units in height.
        chunkSize - the number of units that make a chunk.

      • updateObject

        protected void updateObject(T t)
        Updates what chunk the object is stored in based on the position of the object. If the object isn't registered this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        t - the object.

      • getObjectsInArea

        public java.util.List<T> getObjectsInArea(T t,
                                          int radius)
        Returns all objects from all chunks within the defined 'radius' of the square with the center being the given object.
        Parameters:
        t - the object used as a center point.
        radius - the 'radius' of the square measured in chunks.
        Returns:
        a list of objects from all chunks within the defined 'radius' of the square with the center being the given object.

      • getObjectsInArea

        public java.util.List<T> getObjectsInArea(int cx,
                                          int cy,
                                          int radius)
        Returns all objects from all chunks within the defined 'radius' of the square.
        Parameters:
        cx - the center point of the square on the x axis, measured in chunks.
        cy - the center point of the square on the y axis, measured in chunks.
        radius - the 'radius' of the square measured in chunks.
        Returns:
        a list of objects from all chunks within the defined 'radius' of the square.

      • getObjectsInRectangle

        public java.util.List<T> getObjectsInRectangle(int cx,
                                               int cy,
                                               int cw,
                                               int ch)
        Returns all objects from all chunks within the defined rectangle.
        Parameters:
        cx - the upper left corner of the rectangle on the x axis, measured in chunks.
        cy - the upper left corner of the rectangle on the y axis, measured in chunks.
        cw - the width of the rectangle, measured in chunks.
        ch - the height of the rectangle, measured in chunks.
        Returns:
        a list of objects from all chunks within the defined rectangle.
